N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 ยง 910.4 - Issuance of official new york state prescription forms and facility labels

State Regulations
(a) Issuance of
official New York State prescription forms to registered practitioners or
official New York State prescription forms or facility labels to registered
facilities. (1)

The department will issue
official New York State prescription forms free of charge only to registered
practitioners and registered facilities in this State. The department will
issue facility labels free of charge only to registered facilities exempted
under section
910.2
(a) of this

Part. Such forms and labels shall not be transferable. The number of official
prescription forms or facility labels issued to a registered practitioner or
registered facility at any time shall be at the discretion of the
department. (2)

Official New York

State prescription forms shall be imprinted only with the primary address and
other addresses listed on the registration of the facility or practitioner. Such prescriptions and facility labels shall be sent only to the primary
address of the registered practitioner or registered facility. (3)

Official New York State prescription
forms issued to a practitioner may be used only by the practitioner(s) to whom
they are issued. Official prescriptions or facility labels issued to a facility
may be used by staff practitioners only for patients of the registered
facility. (4)

The department may
determine that certain official New York State prescription forms or facility
labels shall be valid for a limited period of time. (5)

The department may revoke or cancel
official New York State prescription forms or facility labels in possession of
registered practitioners or registered facilities when the license of such
practitioner or facility is suspended, terminated, or revoked. (6)

Official New York State prescription
forms or facility labels of registered facilities that are no longer operating
or of registered practitioners who are deceased or who no longer prescribe
shall be returned to the Bureau of Narcotic Enforcement, NYS Department of

Health or its designee, at a designated address. If the registered practitioner
is deceased, it is the responsibility of the registered practitioner's estate
or lawful designee to return such forms. (b) Notwithstanding any other provision of
this Part, the department may issue official prescription forms or facility
labels to employees or agents of the department and other government agencies
for the purpose of preventing, identifying, investigating and prosecuting
unacceptable or illegal practices by providers and other persons and assisting
in the recovery of overpayments under any program operated by the State or paid
for with State funds. Such prescription forms or facility labels shall be
issued for this purpose only to individuals who are authorized to conduct
investigations on behalf of the department or other government agencies as part
of their official duties. Individuals and agencies receiving such prescription
forms or facility labels for this purpose shall provide appropriate assurances
to the department that adequate safeguards and security measures are in place
to prevent the use of such prescription forms or facility labels for anything
other than official government purposes. Notes
